com.amazon.speech.speechlet

Class SpeechletRequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.speech.speechlet.SpeechletRequestHandler

  • public class SpeechletRequestHandler
extends Object
    The SpeechletRequestHandler processes an incoming request from the Alexa service, decides what action to take on the configured Speechlet, executes that call, and returns the resulting response bytes. This class can be hosted by a servlet (for instance, for a web server) or by AWS Lambda. In either case, the logic is the same with different surrounding logic to handle the generated output bytes.

      Processes the provided bytes as a request from the Alexa service and generates an appropriate response after dispatching the request to the appropriate method calls on the Speechlet provided at construction time.

    • Method Detail

      • handleSpeechletCall

        public byte[] handleSpeechletCall(Speechlet speechlet,
                         byte[] serializedSpeechletRequest)
                           throws IOException,
                                  SpeechletRequestHandlerException,
                                  SpeechletException
        Processes the provided bytes as a request from the Alexa service and generates an appropriate response after dispatching the request to the appropriate method calls on the Speechlet provided at construction time.
        Parameters:
        speechlet - the speechlet to be invoked
        serializedSpeechletRequest - the request coming from Alexa service
        Returns:
        the response that should be returned to the Alexa service. This comes from the appropriate method call in the configured Speechlet
        Throws:
        IOException - may occur during request or response serialization
        SpeechletRequestHandlerException - indicates a problem with the request or response
        SpeechletException - indicates a problem from within the included Speechlet
